info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:49AM EDT until July 29 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WABASH...GRANT...BLACKFORD...SOUTHERN HUNTINGTON AND SOUTHERN WELLS COUNTIES... At 248 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Huntington to near Windfall, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marion, Hartford City, Gas City, Upland, Fairmount, Montpelier, Jonesboro, Sweetser, Swayzee, La Fontaine, Van Buren, Matthews, Warren, Fowlerton, Shamrock Lakes, Poneto, Mcnatts, Landess, Wellsburg, and Liberty Center. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 278. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
